text: Hi everyone, today I'm making
a really interesting fusion dish it's Tom Yum Pho.
It's the perfect marriage between the Thai
most delicious soup Tom Yum
and the Vietnamese most popular noodle soup.
Let's begin!
(music)
You will need: 30g of galangal
cut into slices and 3 stalks of lemongrass
cut into short lengths on the bias,
I also have 2 large cloves of garlic and 1 shallot here.
These are the normal aromatic ingredients
for the Tom Yum soup.
Normally, the Thai people will throw all these
into the soup directly.But today I'm gonna give it a little twist
by applying the Vietnamese Pho cooking technique
by grilling all these items to bring out the aroma
Just grill on low heat for a couple of minutes
until it's charred on the outside.
Then rinse off to clean off the black bits.
Then add all these grilled roots into a pot
filled with 1,5 litters of water
Bring to a boil then lower the heat
and cook for about 7 minutes on low
So that these roots will release the amazing aroma
and infuse into that broth.
You'll also need about 5 kaffir lime leaves
and just roughly tear and add into the soup pot for more fragrance
add a tsp of sugar and a tsp of stock powder
for some sweetness
and the sour and savory factor are gonna be added in later.
Then I add half a cup of mushroom, I'm using straw mushroom cut in halves
But you can also use oyster mushroom,
button mushroom or any other kinds.
Turn the heat to high and add about half a kilogram of prawns.
We will cook them whole on high heat
to bring out that orange color.
Then add 3 chilies cut into slices
and half a cup of sliced onion
cook for a minute
and then turn off the heat
Now add 3 tbs of lime juice,
3 tbs of fish sauce
and a teaspoon of Tom Yum paste
or Vietnamese sa tế
the lime juice should be added off the heat so that it wouldn't
make the soup bitter.
Now add the pho noodle into the serving bowl
and then ladle that delicious, aromatic broth
all over and of course
together with the prawns
and the mushroom
garnish with some coriander leaves and there you have it.
the delicious, aromatic TomYum Pho.
It can't get any better than this.
Best to serve with a side bowl of salt,pepper, lime sauce
or "muối tiêu chanh"
It's so easy to make but the result is phenomenon.
I hope you enjoy today's recipe
and if you are a Phoholic just like I am
don't forget to get a copy of my Simply Pho cookbook.
It's available now on Amazon and all other bookstore on and offline
I'll put the link right here for you to other now
if you're ready
See you again in the next video.Thank you for watching.Bye-bye
